generatedPrompts.frontCover: A lighthearted and humorous birthday greeting card front cover, in a beautiful watercolor style. A flat 2D cartoon illustration of Jordan, created from the reference photo, is shown joyfully struggling to hold a ridiculously oversized, melting ice cream cone with at least five scoops of different pastel-colored ice cream, sprinkles flying everywhere. Next to Jordan, a smaller cartoon illustration of John, created from the reference photo, is laughing and pointing, holding a single, perfectly neat scoop of ice cream. The background is a soft, minimalist wash of pale blue and sunny yellow watercolor, with artistic paint splatters and visible paper texture. In the center, the greeting "happy birthday" is written in a beautiful, flowing, and readable handwritten cursive script in a dark teal color. The overall style is soft and flowing, with organic paint bleeds and visible brush strokes.

Next to Jordan, a smaller cartoon illustration of John, created from the reference photo, is laughing and pointing, holding a single, perfectly neat scoop of ice cream. The background is a soft, minimalist wash of pale blue and sunny yellow watercolor, with artistic paint splatters and visible paper texture. In the center, the greeting "happy birthday" is written in a beautiful, flowing, and readable handwritten cursive script in a dark teal color. The overall style is soft and flowing, with organic paint bleeds and visible brush strokes.". 
    
Use only 20% visual density - perhaps a single small element, subtle corner detail, or soft color gradient. Most of the back should be clean, peaceful space. Think elegant minimalism. IMPORTANT: DO NOT include any people, characters, or figures. in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds - Flat 2D artwork for printing
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing - IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated for QR code placement

generatedPrompts.rightInterior:
Create a right interior page where this message is the absolute star: "Jordan,
Happy birthday! I was going to make a joke about you getting old, but I decided against it... out of respect for my elders. Hope you have a fantastic day filled with cake and questionable decisions!
Best,
John". 

Use subtle style elements from the front design but keep decoration minimal (10-20% of page). Extract color hints from: "A lighthearted and humorous birthday greeting card front cover, in a beautiful watercolor style. A flat 2D cartoon illustration of Jordan, created from the reference photo, is shown joyfully struggling to hold a ridiculously oversized, melting ice cream cone with at least five scoops of different pastel-colored ice cream, sprinkles flying everywhere. The background is a soft, minimalist wash of pale blue and sunny yellow watercolor, with artistic paint splatters and visible paper texture. In the center, the greeting "happy birthday" is written in a beautiful, flowing, and readable handwritten cursive script in a dark teal color. The overall style is soft and flowing, with organic paint bleeds and visible brush strokes.".

- EXACT TEXT REPRODUCTION: The message text must be reproduced EXACTLY as written - every word, punctuation mark, and character must be perfect
- PUT TEXT IN QUOTES: Always enclose the message text in double quotes to make it clear this is literal text to be rendered exactly
- CRYSTAL CLEAR LEGIBILITY: The handwriting must be extremely readable - prioritize clarity over artistic flourishes
- NO SPELLING ERRORS: Every word must be spelled correctly exactly as provided
- PROPER SPACING: Use appropriate letter spacing, word spacing, and line spacing for easy reading
- CONTRAST: Ensure high contrast between text and background for maximum readability
- SIZE: Make text large enough to read easily - avoid cramped or tiny text
- COMPLETE MESSAGE: Include the ENTIRE message text - do not truncate, abbreviate, or omit any part
- Use beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal
- Position the message text in the optimal location for readability (center area, avoid top/bottom 10%) 

Think premium stationery - mostly white space, perfect message placement, and just a touch of elegant decoration (corner details, small flourish, or soft wash). The message should dominate the visual hierarchy.
